title: Assessment Data Responses
text: designed package return two ‘types’ assessment response API, refer ‘minimal’ ‘full’ assessment responses.

title: Assessment Data Responses
text: ‘minimal’ response returns tibble() containing just enough information user gather full assessment data assessment interested . example, may interested knowing assessments habitat code 1 coded : query parameters (arguments) passed assessments_by_group() ’ll get dataframe row unique assessment ID Red List database scopes years. point may choose filter just assessments scope ‘Eastern Africa’ ‘Pan-Africa’: use ‘minimal’ dataframe loop assessment ID gather ‘full’ assessment data assessment: know priori assessments need, can supply appropriate arguments assessments_by_group() directly, save filtering task downstream (also likely save calls API database):
code: a <- assessments_by_group(api, "habitats", "1")  # A tibble: 114 × 7    sis_taxon_id assessment_id latest year_published scopes_description_en scopes_code url                                                          <int>         <int> <lgl>  <chr>          <chr>                 <chr>       <chr>                                               1       133958       3881104 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/133958/3881104  2       134059       3887925 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134059/3887925  3       134019       3893117 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134019/3893117  4       134151       3910739 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134151/3910739  5       134199       3918266 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134199/3918266  6       134378       3947233 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134378/3947233  7       134409       3952097 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134409/3952097  8       134409       3952097 TRUE   2008           Eastern Africa        18          https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134409/3952097  9       134409       3952097 TRUE   2008           Pan-Africa            10          https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134409/3952097 10       134438       3956693 TRUE   2008           Global                1           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/134438/3956693 # title: Assessment Data Responses
text: Minimal assessment data returned assessments_by_ functions: assessments_by_group() assessments_by_name() assessments_by_sis_id() assessments_by_taxonomy()

title: Assessment Data Responses
text: contrast ‘minimal’ responses, can get ‘full’ assessment data first calling assessment_data() get assessment data ‘raw’ format: function returns full response API, transformations (except coercing JSON lists). can call parse_assessment_data() get tidied named list tibbles: calling parse_assessment_data() allowing {iucnredlist} package perform number data tidying routines. nutshell function : Tidy ‘taxon’ element raw response, moving Common Names, SSC Groups Synonyms named elements top-level list, prepending parts response taxon_. Move conservation_actions_in_place conservation_actions top-level Remove ‘documentation’ part response. mostly long paragraphs text HTML. part response important work, recommend fetching object created assessment_data() process according needs. Ordering named lists alphabetically
code: # Get full assessment data for the black rhino a <- assessment_data(api, 152728945) a <- parse_assessment_data(a)

title: Assessment Data Responses
text: Full assessment data returned functions: assessment_data() assessment_data_many()

title: Gather Common Data
text: tutorial created walk gathering common data IUCN Red List API. Part 1, stay completely within API getting list species’ assessments directly taxon endpoint. Part 2, show import list species’ names perform data gathering steps.

what: Part 1 - Gather habitats & threats for the felidae
title: Gather Common Data
text: First, ’ll want load package R session initialise connection Red List API. Initialising connection require valid API token. don’t already one, can sign one . now need gather list (latest) assessments whose species belong family felidae: aim gather habitats threats coded assessments, must now iterate unique assessment ID tibble get data. Helpfully, ’s function available just : runs, full assessment data 50 unique assessment IDs (time publication). , can extract data interested : extract_element() function super helpful. returns tidy dataframe element ’re interested; row unique element assessment ID assessments gathered full assessment data : can now threats: , know elements available extract data ? short answer can call element_names() get : long answer element names simply named elements parsed assessment data object. just well run names(felidae_full[[1]]) get list element names. Pass element names extract_element() get tidy dataframe elements.
code: library(iucnredlist) api <- init_api("your_api_token") felidae <- assessments_by_taxonomy(api, level = "family", name = "felidae", latest = TRUE)  # A tibble: 52 × 7    sis_taxon_id assessment_id latest year_published scopes_description_en scopes_code url                                                         <int>         <int> <lgl>  <chr>          <chr>                 <chr> 12519       3350985 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean         4           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/12519/3350985  3        15951       5325996 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean         4           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/15951/5325996  4        15954       5328595 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean         4           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/15954/5328595  5        15955       5330476 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean         4           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/15955/5330476  6         3847      10121483 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/8540/12915840  8         8540      12916263 TRUE   2007           Europe                2           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/8540/12916263  9         8541      12916598 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean         4           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/8541/12916598 10          219      13034035 TRUE   2010           Mediterranean         4           https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/219/13034035  # ℹ 42 more rows # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows # Pass assessment IDs into the assessment_data_many() function felidae_full <- assessment_data_many(api, assessment_ids = felidae$assessment_id) habitats <- extract_element(felidae_full, "habitats") habitats  # A tibble: 452 × 7    index    assessment_id majorImportance season what: Part 2 - Gather habitats & threats for a custom list of species
title: Gather Common Data
text: Part 1, showed stay completely within API get habitats threats felidae. list binomial names? sake tutorial, let’s build quick tibble() species : get ‘minimal’ assessment data first species list, just see looks like: single species probably isn’t useful, let’s write quick loop iterate Latin binomial get latest global assessments: , can now pass list assessment IDs like : can now extract habitats threats :
code: my_species <- dplyr::tibble(genus = c("Panthera", "Diceros", "Cyclura"),                              species = c("leo", "bicornis", "pinguis")) assessments_by_name(api,                      genus = my_species$genus[1],                      species = my_species$species[1]) assessments <-list()  for(i in 1:nrow(my_species)){   assessments[[i]] <- assessments_by_name(api,                                            genus = my_species$genus[i],                                            species = my_species$species[i]) }  # Unlist into a tibble a <- dplyr::bind_rows(assessments)  # Filter on latest global assessments a <- a %>%    dplyr::filter(latest == TRUE & scopes_code == 1) full_data <- assessment_data_many(api,                                    unique(a$assessment_id),                                   wait_time=0.5) habitats <- extract_element(full_data, "habitats") threats <- extract_element(full_data, "habitats")

what: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: International Union Conservation Nature’s Red List Threatened Species evolved become world’s comprehensive information source global conservation status animal, fungi plant species. ’s critical indicator health world’s biodiversity. IUCN Red List API developed inform drive biodiversity conservation policy change -— critical steps protecting essential natural resources. provides programmatic access data including (limited ); population size, habitat ecology, trade threats help support informed conservation decisions. iucnredlist R package aims serve client library Red List API, offering research community users efficient user-friendly tool access interact vital data services provided IUCN Red List. open sourced package promote transparency, enable research community contributions, drive adoption API. official IUCN-supported library, shall maintain synchronisation API changes updates. proponents tidyverse worked ensure outputs iucnredlist functions conform tidy data principles possible.

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: use API falls Terms Use Red List. requesting token, agreeing abide Terms Use Red List. token usage found breach terms use, revoked. kindly request cooperation ensuring responsible respectful usage services. Please aware misusing API token, using information extraction (scraping) rather making legitimate requests non-commercial purposes, may result token rate limited /revoked. committed maintaining high-quality service users implemented rate limiting system ensure resources accessible equally . actively monitor API usage prevent abuse. understand users may unique requirements making frequent calls succession. find situation, kindly request incorporate appropriate delays API calls ensure smooth operation prevent overloading system, otherwise token may rate-limited. ’s important note Red List API primarily designed support conservation efforts, particularly fields education research. may need restrict access API used purposes align mission, mobile app development, inclusion computing courses, visualization projects unrelated conservation. Use Red List API commercial purposes strictly forbidden. Users wish use Red List data commercial purposes consider subscribing IBAT.

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: committed ensuring fast reliable access users API. end, implemented rate limiting maintain service reliability users. Several functions within package argument called wait_time - recommend setting >=0.5 seconds (default 0.5 seconds) avoid rate limiting. build functions package, recommend implement appropriate wait time code avoid limits.

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: can install development version iucnredlist GitHub :

title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
text: iucnredlist package contains number functions allow quick access Red List data. examples quick-start scripts get familiar basic iucnredlist workflow. running code, must first sign Red List API obtain API token. can view (cycle) token account page.

what: Fetch data for a single assessment
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Fetch assessment data for assessment_id = 266696959 (Panthera leo) # Returns a list containing all assessment data assessment_raw <- assessment_data(api, 266696959)  # Parse the 'raw' assessment data to tidy tibbles assessment <- parse_assessment_data(assessment_raw)  # View e.g. threats or habitats # The result is a tidy 'tibble()` of data assessment$threats assessment$habitats

what: Fetch all assessments for an SIS taxon ID
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Get 'minimal' assessment data for the European Sturgeon sturgeon <- assessments_by_sis_id(api, 230)

what: Gather full assessment data for many assessment IDs
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Using the sturgeon assessment IDs from above example, get full assessment data sturgeon_all <- assessment_data_many(api, sturgeon$assessment_id)  # View theats sturgeon_threats <- extract_element(sturgeon_all, "threats")

what: Fetch all assessments for a Latin binomial name
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Get all historic and latest assessments for Panthera leo (not case-sensitive) lion <- assessments_by_name(api, genus = "panthera", species = "leo")

what: Show threats for a taxonomic level
title: An R package for the IUCN Red List API
code: # Initialize the API with your API key api <- init_api("your_red_list_api_key")  # Step 1: Get all latest and global-scope assessment IDs for the family Felidae felidae <- assessments_by_taxonomy(api,   level = "family",   name = "felidae",   latest = TRUE,   scope_code = 1,   wait_time = 0.5 )  # Step 2: Fetch assessment data for each assessment ID # Pass the assessment_id column to `assessment_data_many() to grab # full assessment data for each assessment_id a_data <- assessment_data_many(api,   felidae$assessment_id,   wait_time = 0.5 )  # Step 3: Extract habitats from the assessment data # This will iterate over each assessment in the list a_data # and return a tidy `tibble()` for all habitats habitats <- extract_element(a_data, "habitats")  # Alternatively, extract threats threats <- extract_element(a_data, "threats")  # See all elements you can extract - use any of these with `extract_element()` element_names()

Get full assessment data for a vector of assessment IDs — assessment_data_many
text: api httr2 response object created init_api(). assessment_ids Vector. vector valid assessment IDs. wait_time Time seconds wait API calls. wait 0.5 seconds greater ensure hit IUCN Red List API rate limit.

what: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
text: assessment_by_ functions including assessments_by_group() return 'minimal' assessment data specified filters (arguments). minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids (tibble) can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() parse_assessment_data() get full assessment data. assessments_by_group() function acts upon API assessment group names codes. Valid names can found calling list_group_names() codes can found list_codes(api, "scopes").

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
code: assessments_by_group(   api,   group,   code,   year_published = NULL,   latest = TRUE,   scope_code = NULL,   wait_time = 0.5,   show_warnings = TRUE )

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
text: api httr2 response object created init_api(). group String. valid API group name. Valid names can found calling list_group_names(). code String. valid group code. Valid codes API group can found calling e.g. list_codes(api, "habitats") year_published Integer. publication year wish filter. latest Boolean. Return latest historic assessments. Defaults TRUE. scope_code String. valid assessment scope. Defaults NULL (.e. returns assessments scopes). Valid scope codes can found calling list_codes(api, "scopes"). wait_time Float. Time seconds wait API calls. wait time >=0.5s avoid API rate limiting. show_warnings Boolean. Whether show warning console assessments found specified arguments. Defaults TRUE.

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group
text: Returns tibble() minimal assessment data specified arguments. minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() parse_assessment_data() get full assessment data.

title: Get minimal assessment data for an API group — assessments_by_group

what: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
text: assessment_by_ functions including assessments_by_taxonomy() return 'minimal' assessment data specified filters (arguments). minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids (tibble) can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() parse_assessment_data() get full assessment data. assessments_by_taxonomy() returns minimal assessment data given taxonomic hierarchy name.

title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
code: assessments_by_taxonomy(   api,   level,   name,   year_published = NULL,   latest = TRUE,   scope_code = NULL,   wait_time = 0.5 )

title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
text: api httr2 response object created init_api(). level String. level taxonomic hierachy. Must one : kingdom, phylum, class, order family. name String. name taxonomic hierarchy. year_published Integer. publication year wish filter. latest Boolean. Return latest historic assessments. Defaults TRUE. scope_code String. valid assessment scope. Defaults NULL (.e. returns assessments scopes). Valid scope codes can found calling list_codes(api, "scopes"). wait_time Time seconds wait API calls. wait 0.5 seconds greater ensure hit IUCN Red List API rate limit. Defaults TRUE.

title: Get minimal assessment data for a taxonomic level — assessments_by_taxonomy
text: Returns tibble() minimal assessment data specified arguments. minimal assessment data provides assessment_ids sis_taxon_ids can used assessment_data(), assessment_data_many() parse_assessment_data() get full assessment data.

Parse raw assessment data — parse_assessment_data
text: Transforms list raw assessment data assessment_data() converts opinionated list unnested tibbles. purpose function generate 'tidy' tibbles raw response, feel easier work downstream analyses. Due complexity taxon response, tidied 'taxon' element, moving Common Names, SSC Groups Synonyms named elements list, prepending parts response taxon_. process applied conservation_actions_in_place, nested conservation_actions raw response. Finally, ordered named lists alphabetically. , now, omitted raw response's 'documentation' element mostly long paragraphs text HTML. important work, recommend fetching object created assessment_data() process according needs.

what: Parse raw green status of species (gss) assessment data — parse_gss_data
title: Parse raw green status of species (gss) assessment data — parse_gss_data
text: Transforms list raw gss assessment data gss_data_all() converts tibble single row per assessment. purpose function generate 'tidy' tibble raw response, feel easier work downstream analyses. Due complexity taxon response, included basic taxonomic information enable filtering taxonomy species level. extended text fields 'justification', 'assessor_names', 'reviewer_names' 'contributors', 'facilitators', 'compilers', 'url' 'authority' included tibble returned function. important work, recommend fetching data object created gss_data_all() process according needs.
